content.body:
**Response Details**

| Key                  | Type       | Description                                                                                                                  |
| -------------------- | ---------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| margin\_balance      | \[decimal] | The USD value of all your trading assets (based on last prices)                                                              |
| unrealized\_pl       | \[decimal] | The unrealized profit/loss of all your open positions                                                                        |
| unrealized\_swap     | \[decimal] | The margin funding used by all your open positions                                                                           |
| net\_value           | \[decimal] | Your net value (the USD value of your trading wallet, including your margin balance, your unrealized P/L and margin funding) |
| required\_margin     | \[decimal] | The minimum net value to maintain in your trading wallet, under which all of your positions are fully liquidated             |
| margin\_limits       | \[array]   | The list of margin limits for each pair. The array gives you the following information, for each pair                        |
| on\_pair             | \[string]  | The pair for which these limits are valid                                                                                    |
| initial\_margin      | \[decimal] | The minimum margin (in %) to maintain to open or increase a position                                                         |
| tradable\_balance    | \[decimal] | Your tradable balance in USD (the maximum size you can open on leverage for this pair)                                       |
| margin\_requirements | \[decimal] | The maintenance margin (% of the USD value of all of your open positions in the current pair to maintain)                    |

> ðŸ“˜ Limited to Margin Trading
>
> The v1/margin\_infos endpoint is limited to margin trading and does not provide information related to derivatives trading.

**Ratelimit**: 30 req/min
content.excerpt: See your trading wallet information for margin trading.

get.description: The ticker is a high level overview of the state of the market. It shows you the current best bid and ask, as well as the last trade price. It also includes information such as daily volume and how much the price has moved over the last day.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: The symbol you want information about. You can find the list of valid symbols by calling the [rest-public-symbols](https://docs.bitfinex.com/v1/reference#rest-public-symbols) endpoint.

code-samples.code:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'

url = URI("https://api.bitfinex.com/v1/pubticker/btcusd")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true

request = Net::HTTP::Get.new(url)

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

import requests

url = "https://api.bitfinex.com/v1/pubticker/btcusd"

response = requests.request("GET", url)

print(response.text)
code-samples.name: Python

code-samples.code:
curl --request GET \
  --url https://api.bitfinex.com/v1/pubticker/btcusd

post.description: Return information about your account (trading fees)

parameters.name: X-BFX-APIKEY
parameters.description: Your API Key

parameters.name: X-BFX-PAYLOAD
parameters.description: JSON String of Payload in base64

parameters.name: X-BFX-SIGNATURE
parameters.description: SHA-384 HMAC of the Payload using your API Secret as the key

post.description: See the fees applied to your withdrawals

Result.value:
// a message containing your error, for example:
{ message: 'X-BFX-APIKEY header was not sent.' }

post.description: Return your deposit address to make a new deposit.

method.description: Method of deposit (methods accepted: â€œbitcoinâ€, â€œlitecoinâ€, â€œethereumâ€, â€œtetheruso", â€œtetherusl", â€œtetherusx", â€œtetheruss", "ethereumc", "zcash", "monero", "iota"). For an up-to-date listing of supported currencies see: https://api.bitfinex.com/v2/conf/pub:map:currency:label

wallet_name.description: Wallet to deposit in (accepted: â€œtradingâ€, â€œexchangeâ€, â€œdepositâ€). Your wallet needs to already exist

renew.description: Default is 0. If set to 1, will return a new unused deposit address. Previous addresses are still valid

post.description: Allow you to move available balances between your wallets.

currency.description: Currency of funds to transfer. For an up-to-date listing of supported currencies see: https://api.bitfinex.com/v2/conf/pub:map:currency:label

walletfrom.description: Wallet to transfer from. Can be â€œtradingâ€, â€œdepositâ€ or â€œexchangeâ€

walletto.description: Wallet to transfer to. Can be â€œtradingâ€, â€œdepositâ€ or â€œexchangeâ€

post.description: Allow you to request a withdrawal from one of your wallet.

parameters.name: withdraw_type
parameters.description: defines the currency your are trying to withdraw, see the "Withdrawal Types" section below for accepted values

parameters.name: walletselected
parameters.description: The wallet to withdraw from, can be â€œtradingâ€, â€œexchangeâ€, or â€œdepositâ€.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount to withdraw.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: (1) Destination address for withdrawal. (Not used when withdraw_type=wire)

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Desired currency for wire requests (USD|EUR|JPY|GPB)

parameters.name: payment_id
parameters.description: Optional hex string for currencies that require a memo, tag, or ID..

parameters.name: account_name
parameters.description: Account name

parameters.name: account_number
parameters.description: Account number

parameters.name: account_address
parameters.description: Account address

parameters.name: swift
parameters.description: The SWIFT code for your bank.

parameters.name: bank_name
parameters.description: Bank name

parameters.name: bank_address
parameters.description: Bank address

parameters.name: bank_city
parameters.description: Bank city

parameters.name: bank_country
parameters.description: Bank country

parameters.name: detail_payment
parameters.description: Message to beneficiary

parameters.name: expressWire
parameters.description: â€œ1â€ to submit an express wire withdrawal, â€œ0â€ or omit for a normal withdrawal

parameters.name: intermediary_bank_name
parameters.description: Intermediary bank name

parameters.name: intermediary_bank_address
parameters.description: Intermediary bank address

parameters.name: intermediary_bank_city
parameters.description: Intermediary bank city

parameters.name: intermediary_bank_country
parameters.description: Intermediary bank country

parameters.name: intermediary_bank_account
parameters.description: Intermediary bank account

parameters.name: intermediary_bank_swift
parameters.description: Intermediary bank SWIFT

parameters.name: travel_rule_tos
parameters.description: Flag to voluntarily send travel rule details for crypto withdrawal

parameters.name: vasp_did
parameters.description: Virtual asset provider identifier, optional info for travel rule purpose. DID values can be found on https://api-pub.bitfinex.com/v2/ext/vasps endpoint.

parameters.name: vasp_name
parameters.description: Virtual asset provider name, optional info for travel rule purpose, if self custody ignore the field

parameters.name: beneficiary_self
parameters.description: Set to 'true' to extract destination data from your KYC data. (If 'true', dest_firstname, dest_lastname, or dest_corp_name do not need to be supplied)

parameters.name: dest_firstname
parameters.description: Destination entity first name for travel rule purpose (mandatory if dest_lastname is supplied, not required if beneficiary_self = true)

parameters.name: dest_lastname
parameters.description: Destination entity last name for travel rule purpose (mandatory if dest_firstname is supplied, not required if beneficiary_self = true)

parameters.name: dest_corp_name
parameters.description: Destination entity corporate name for travel rule purpose. (use either dest_firstname + dest_lastname or dest_corp_name, not required if beneficiary_self = true)

message.example: Your withdrawal request has been successfully submitted.

code-samples.name: JavaScript

code-samples.code: response = client.withdraw("bitcoin","deposit",1000, address: "1DKwqRhDmVyHJDL4FUYpDmQMYA3Rsxtvur")

post.description: Submit a new Order, can be used to create margin, exchange, and derivative orders.

amount.description: Order size: how much you want to buy or sell

price.description: Price to buy or sell at. Must be positive. Use random number for market orders. Note: For 'trailing-stop' orders, the price represents the desired 'distance'

type.description: Either â€œmarketâ€ / â€œlimitâ€ / â€œstopâ€ / "stop limit" / â€œtrailing-stopâ€ / â€œfill-or-killâ€ / "immediate-or-cancel" / â€œexchange marketâ€ / â€œexchange limitâ€ / â€œexchange stopâ€ / "exchange stop limit" / â€œexchange trailing-stopâ€ / â€œexchange fill-or-killâ€ / "exchange immediate-or-cancel" . (type starting by â€œexchange â€ are exchange orders, others are margin trading orders)

buy_stoplimit_price.description: Specify the limit price on a stop limit buy or exchange stop limit buy order

sell_stoplimit_price.description: Specify the limit price on a stop limit sell or exchange stop limit sell order

is_hidden.description: true if the order should be hidden.

is_postonly.description: true if the order should be post only. Only relevant for limit orders.

use_all_available.description: 1 will post an order that will use all of your available balance.

ocoorder.description: Set an additional STOP OCO order that will be linked with the current order.

buy_price_oco.description: If ocoorder is true, this field represent the price of the OCO stop order to place

sell_price_oco.description: If ocoorder is true, this field represent the price of the OCO stop order to place

lev.description: Set the leverage for a derivative order, supported by derivative symbol orders only. The value should be between 1 and 100 inclusive. The field is optional, if omitted the default leverage value of 10 will be used.

aff_code.description: Allows you to pass along an affiliate code with your API orders

code-samples.name: JavaScript

code-samples.code: client.new_order("BTCUSD", 100, "market", "sell", 0)
code-samples.name: Ruby

post.description: Submit several new orders at once, can be used to create margin, exchange, and derivative orders.

amount.description: Order size: how much you want to buy or sell

price.description: Price to buy or sell at. Must be positive. Use random number for market orders.

type.description: Either â€œmarketâ€ / â€œlimitâ€ / â€œstopâ€ / "stop limit" / â€œtrailing-stopâ€ / â€œfill-or-killâ€ / "immediate-or-cancel" / â€œexchange marketâ€ / â€œexchange limitâ€ / â€œexchange stopâ€ / "exchange stop limit" / â€œexchange trailing-stopâ€ / â€œexchange fill-or-killâ€ / "exchange immediate-or-cancel" . (type starting by â€œexchange â€ are exchange orders, others are margin trading orders)

lev.description: Set the leverage for a derivative order, supported by derivative symbol orders only. The value should be between 1 and 100 inclusive. The field is optional, if omitted the default leverage value of 10 will be used.

buy_stoplimit_price.description: Specify the limit price on a stop limit buy or exchange stop limit buy order

sell_stoplimit_price.description: Specify the limit price on a stop limit sell or exchange stop limit sell order

code-samples.name: JavaScript

code-samples.code: response = client.multiple_orders([{symbol: "btcusd", amount: 10, price: 0, exchange: "bitfinex", side: "buy", type: "market"}])
code-samples.name: Ruby

post.description: Replace an order with a new one. Can be used to replace an order with a new margin, exchange, or derivative order.

amount.description: Order size: how much to buy or sell.

price.description: Price to buy or sell at. May omit if a market order.

type.description: Either â€œmarketâ€ / â€œlimitâ€ / â€œstopâ€ / â€œtrailing-stopâ€ / â€œfill-or-killâ€ / â€œexchange marketâ€ / â€œexchange limitâ€ / â€œexchange stopâ€ / â€œexchange trailing-stopâ€ / â€œexchange fill-or-killâ€. (type starting by â€œexchange â€ are exchange orders, others are margin trading orders)

is_hidden.description: true if the order should be hidden.

is_postonly.description: true if the order should be post only. Only relevant for limit orders.

use_remaining.description: True if the new order should use the remaining amount of the original order.

lev.description: Set the leverage for a derivative order, supported by derivative symbol orders only. The value should be between 1 and 100 inclusive. The field is optional, if omitted the default leverage value of 10 will be used.

aff_code.description: Allows you to pass along an affiliate code with your API orders

code-samples.name: Ruby

post.description:
A position can be claimed if:

It is a long position: The amount in the last unit of the position pair that you have in your trading wallet AND/OR the realized profit of the position is greater or equal to the purchase amount of the position (base price * position amount) and the funds which need to be returned. For example, for a long BTCUSD position, you can claim the position if the amount of USD you have in the trading wallet is greater than the base price * the position amount and the funds used.

It is a short position: The amount in the first unit of the position pair that you have in your trading wallet is greater or equal to the amount of the position and the margin funding used.

parameters.name: position_id
parameters.description: The position ID given by `/positions`.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The partial amount you wish to claim.

code-samples.name: JavaScript

code-samples.code: client.claim_position(100,10)
code-samples.name: Ruby

post.description: View all of your balance ledger entries.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency to look for. For an up-to-date listing of supported currencies see: https://api.bitfinex.com/v2/conf/pub:map:currency:label

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Return only the history after this timestamp. (Max 3 months before until)

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: Return only the history before this timestamp. (Default now)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of entries to return.

parameters.name: wallet
parameters.description: Return only entries that took place in this wallet. Accepted inputs are: â€œtradingâ€, â€œexchangeâ€, â€œdepositâ€.

code-samples.name: JavaScript

code-samples.code: response = client.history
code-samples.name: Ruby

post.description: View your past deposits/withdrawals.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency to look for. For an up-to-date listing of supported currencies see: https://api.bitfinex.com/v2/conf/pub:map:currency:label

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The method of the deposit/withdrawal (can be â€œbitcoinâ€, â€œlitecoinâ€, â€œdarkcoinâ€, â€œwireâ€).

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Return only the history after this timestamp.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: Return only the history before this timestamp.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of entries to return.

code-samples.name: JavaScript

parameters.description: Trades made before this timestamp wonâ€™t be returned.

parameters.description: Trades made after this timestamp wonâ€™t be returned.

parameters.name: limit_trades
parameters.description: Limit the number of trades returned.

parameters.name: reverse
parameters.description: Return trades in reverse order (the oldest comes first). Default is returning newest trades first.

amount.description: The amount you wish to split or merge

code-samples.name: JavaScript

meta.description: See your trading wallet information for margin trading.
meta.title: Margin Information

rdmd.body:
**Response Details**

| Key                  | Type       | Description                                                                                                                  |
| -------------------- | ---------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| margin\_balance      | \[decimal] | The USD value of all your trading assets (based on last prices)                                                              |
| unrealized\_pl       | \[decimal] | The unrealized profit/loss of all your open positions                                                                        |
| unrealized\_swap     | \[decimal] | The margin funding used by all your open positions                                                                           |
| net\_value           | \[decimal] | Your net value (the USD value of your trading wallet, including your margin balance, your unrealized P/L and margin funding) |
| required\_margin     | \[decimal] | The minimum net value to maintain in your trading wallet, under which all of your positions are fully liquidated             |
| margin\_limits       | \[array]   | The list of margin limits for each pair. The array gives you the following information, for each pair                        |
| on\_pair             | \[string]  | The pair for which these limits are valid                                                                                    |
| initial\_margin      | \[decimal] | The minimum margin (in %) to maintain to open or increase a position                                                         |
| tradable\_balance    | \[decimal] | Your tradable balance in USD (the maximum size you can open on leverage for this pair)                                       |
| margin\_requirements | \[decimal] | The maintenance margin (% of the USD value of all of your open positions in the current pair to maintain)                    |

> ðŸ“˜ Limited to Margin Trading
>
> The v1/margin\_infos endpoint is limited to margin trading and does not provide information related to derivatives trading.

**Ratelimit**: 30 req/min

Limited to Margin Trading

The v1/margin_infos endpoint is limited to margin trading and does not provide information related to derivatives trading.

Ratelimit: 30 req/min

Active Funding Not Used in a margin position

promos.title: Introduction
promos.text:
The Bitfinex APIâ€™s are designed to allow access to all of the features of the Bitfinex platform. The end goal is to allow people to potentially recreate the entire platform on their own.

If you would like to suggest changes to the documentation, please see the github at https://github.com/bitfinexcom/api_docs

# Open Source Libraries
The following open source projects are works in progress. We will be continually improving them, but we want to release them early so that the community can take a look, make use of them, and offer pull requests. Nothing in the Bitcoin world exists in isolation.

project.description: The Official Documentation for the Bitfinex API Reference.
project.name: Bitfinex
